citation.article-title: Comparative studies on [Pasteurella] testudinis and [P.] testudinis-like bacteria and proposal of Chelonobacter oris gen. nov., sp. nov. as a new member of the family Pasteurellacea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Chelonobacter oris sp. nov.
Chelonobacter oris (o′ris. L. n. os oris mouth; L. gen. n. oris of/from the mouth).
Colony and cellular morphologies are as given in the genus description.
The surface of the colonies is smooth, shiny and opaque.
Colonies are between 1.0 and 1.5 mm in diameter.
The consistency of the colonies is unguent-like and adherence to the agar is not observed.
In addition to the phenotypic characteristics given in the genus description, acid is produced from (+)-d-arabitol, (−)-d-ribose, (+)-d-xylose, (−)-d-fucose, raffinose and dextrin.
Positive for aesculin hydrolysis and β-glucosidase (NPG).
Negative for citrate utilization and production of acid from adonitol, (−)-d-sorbitol, lactose, melibiose and inulin.
The type strain is indole-negative; a single isolate (18043) is indole-positive.
The type strain is 1662T (=CCUG 55632T=DSM 21392T), isolated from a diseased tortoise.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 47.2 mol%.
